text:
<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SMOTHERED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 cup. chicken broth
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, coat with flour.
Brown in fat, add onion and broth.
Cover, simmer 45 minutes until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE DATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter or Crisco
- 4 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 1/3 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. chopped dates
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 tbsp. grated orange rind
- 3 1/2 cup. sifted cake flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. sifted cake flour
- 1 cup. chopped pecans
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 1 cup fresh orange juice
- 2 tablespoons grated rind
<|steps|>
Cream butter or Crisco, add sugar and cream until smooth.
Blend in eggs, one at a time.
Add orange rind and vanilla.
Sift dry ingredients, measure and sift together and add to creamed mixture, alternating with milk.
Mix 1/2 cup cake flour with chopped dates and pecans and fold into cake mixture.
Turn into a greased tube pan.
Bake at 325 to 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or until done.
**SAUCE**
Blend together sugar, orange juice and grated rind.
Pour over hot cake immediately after removing from oven.
Let cool in pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICICLE PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 lb. cucumbers
- 2 gal. water
- 2 cup. lime
- 3 qt. vinegar
- 3 lb. sugar
- 3 sticks cinnamon
- 2 Tbsp. spice
- 2 Tbsp. whole cloves
- 2 Tbsp. celery seed
- Pears (quantity not specified)
- White vinegar (enough to cover)
- 3 cup. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. mixed pickling spices
- 1 cup. red sweet peppers
- 1 pk. pears
- 2 qt. onions
- 8 green sweet peppers
- 4 red sweet peppers
- 2 hot peppers
- 12 dill pickles
- 2 cup. salt (or 1 cup. if less salty desired)
- 2 Tbsp. turmeric
- 3 Tbsp. dry mustard
- 8 Tbsp. flour
- 4 cup. sugar
- 2 qt. vinegar
<|steps|>
Slice cucumbers 1/4 inch thick, soak in lime water (lime and water) for 24 hours.
Remove from lime water, place in clear water, changing every hour for 4 hours.
Mix vinegar, sugar, and spices, bring to boil, add cucumbers, bring to boiling point.
Remove from heat, let stand overnight.
Bring to boil again, place in jars.
**PEAR RELISH (RECIPE 1)**
Put pears through coarse plate of food chopper, cover with vinegar, let stand 1/2 hour.
Drain off vinegar.
For each pint of pears, add sugar, pickling spices, and red sweet peppers, simmer 15 minutes.
Put in hot jars and seal.
**PEAR RELISH (RECIPE 2)**
Grind all vegetables and pickles, mix with salt, let stand overnight, drain thoroughly.
Mix dry ingredients with vinegar to make a smooth paste, cook until thickened.
Add ground mixture, cook for 10 minutes after it boils.
Put in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEPPER RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 doz. Bell peppers
- 2 doz. hot peppers
- 2 doz. onions
- 1 qt. vinegar
- 3 cup. sugar
- 6 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Grind peppers and onions in food chopper.
Boil with vinegar, sugar, and salt for 30 minutes.
Put in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE CINNAMON BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1.33 cups sugar
- 4 tsp cinnamon
- 0.5 cup softened butter or margarine
- 0.5 cup shortening
- 1 egg
- 1 egg, separated
- 1 6-oz pkg semi-sweet chocolate pieces
- 0.5 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Mix and sift flour, baking powder, 1 cup sugar, and 3 tsp cinnamon.
Add butter, shortening, 1 egg, and 1 egg yolk; blend well.
Spread evenly in a greased 15x10x0.75-inch jelly-roll pan.
Beat egg white slightly and brush over mixture.
Combine 0.33 cup sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, chocolate pieces, and nuts; sprinkle over top.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Cool and cut into bars, for about 24 bars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLESAUCE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. applesauce
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. raisins
- 1/2 cup. nuts
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and applesauce.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROWN SUGAR FROSTING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt butter and brown sugar, boil 2 minutes.
Add milk, bring to boil, cool.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla, beat until smooth.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPECIAL K COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sifted all purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 cup. soft butter or marg.
- 1 cup. powdered sugar, sifted
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup. flaked coconut
- 4 cup. Kellogg's Special K cereal
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. brown sugar, firmly packed
- 1 tsp. almond flavoring
- 1/2 cup. finely chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Sift together flour, baking powder, soda and salt.
Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
Add sifted dry ingredients; mix well.
Add coconut and pecans, stirring in well.
Stir in Special K a cup at the time.
Drop by tablespoonsfull onto an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake in a moderate oven; 300 degrees 10 minutes, or until lightly browned.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE UPSIDE-DOWN CAKE MIX**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 sticks margarine
- 1 box yellow cake mix
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 box coconut
- 1/2 pint whipping cream (optional)
- 10 cherries (optional)
<|steps|>
Melt margarine in the bottom of a 9 x 12-inch pan or casserole dish.
Sprinkle dry yellow cake mix evenly over the margarine.
Spread crushed pineapple evenly over the cake mix.
Sprinkle coconut evenly on top.
Bake at 325°F for about 35 minutes until the coconut is lightly browned.
Top with whipped cream and cherries, if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA FISH CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 tbsp evaporated milk
- 0.25 cup water
- 0.5 cup Velveeta cheese
- 2 tsp butter
- 0.5 cup bread crumbs
- 1.5 tsp onion, minced
- 0.33 cup tuna fish
- 0.33 tsp salt
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 egg
- 1 cup cooked macaroni
<|steps|>
Combine milk, water, cheese, and butter in a saucepan; melt slowly.
Mix in onion, tuna, salt, pepper, egg, and macaroni.
Pour into a greased casserole dish.
Top with bread crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes, for 4-6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE RING WITH FRUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 packages cream cheese
- 0.5 pint cream, whipped
- 0.5 cup grated pineapple
- 2 tbsp gelatine
- 0.25 cup milk
- Mayonnaise, for serving
- Halved pears, for serving
- Peaches, for serving
- White cherries, for serving
- Grapefruit sections, for serving
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in milk and dissolve over hot water.
Mix cream cheese with pineapple.
Add whipped cream mixed with cooled gelatine.
Place in a ring mold to congeal.
Serve with a bowl of mayonnaise in the center, surrounded by halved pears, peaches, white cherries, and grapefruit sections.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STEAMED SHRIMP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. shrimp
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1 lemon, sliced
<|steps|>
Place shrimp, salt, pepper, water, and lemon in steamer.
Steam 10-15 minutes until shrimp are pink.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COUNTRY CAPTAIN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 hen or 2 fryers
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 pod garlic, chopped
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 can (No. 2) tomatoes
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 1/4 cup almonds
- 1 teaspoon curry powder
- 1 teaspoon thyme
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 3 tablespoons corn oil
- 1 can (4 oz) mushrooms
<|steps|>
Boil, bone, and chop chicken, reserving stock.
Sauté green pepper and onion in corn oil until tender.
Add chicken stock, garlic, tomatoes, mushrooms, curry powder, thyme, salt, and pepper; simmer for 10 minutes.
Add chopped chicken, raisins, and almonds; simmer for 1 hour.
Serve over rice, garnished with additional raisins and almonds.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DILL GREEN BEAN CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans (1 pound) whole green beans
- 11/4 teaspoons dill seeds
- 2 tablespoons bacon drippings
- 6 tablespoons flour
- 6 tablespoons oleo
- 3 teaspoons grated onion
- 21/2 teaspoons Accent
- Dash of Tabasco
- 1 cup bean juice
- 11/2 cups milk
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Cook green beans with dill seeds and bacon drippings for 45 minutes, reserving 1 cup of bean juice; let cool.
For the white sauce, melt oleo, then stir in flour, grated onion, Accent, Tabasco, pepper, and salt; cook until thick.
Add bean juice and milk to the sauce, stirring until thickened.
Place green beans in a greased 2-quart casserole, pour white sauce over, and bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until piping hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICEBOX ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. warm water
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 2 eggs
- 5-6 cup. flour
- 2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 3/4 cup. milk
<|steps|>
Mix potatoes, sugar, shortening, and salt.
Dissolve yeast in warm water, add to potato mixture with eggs.
Add flour to make soft dough, knead until smooth.
Place in greased bowl, refrigerate, use as needed.
Shape into rolls, let rise, bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
**ROLLS**
Mix dry ingredients, cut in shortening.
Add milk, stir until dough forms.
Knead lightly, roll out, cut into rolls.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can asparagus tips
- 2 cups cracker crumbs
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1/2 pound grated cheese
- 1/2 cup almonds or pecan meats
- 1 can mushroom soup
- Whole blanched almonds, for garnish
<|steps|>
Grate cheese and mix well with cracker crumbs.
Combine liquid from asparagus with mushroom soup.
In a casserole dish, layer cracker crumbs and cheese, asparagus, nuts, and mushroom soup mixture.
Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of cracker crumbs and cheese.
Decorate the top with whole blanched almonds.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
Optionally, prepare the day before and bake when ready to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPOON BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 1 cup boiling water
- 2 cups sweet milk
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 3 teaspoons baking powder
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 1 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Bring water to a boil and add cornmeal, stirring rapidly until well mixed.
Add sweet milk, butter, baking powder, beaten eggs, and salt.
Mix thoroughly and pour into a baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for about 40 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON GLAZE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice
- 1 1/2 cup. conf. sugar
<|steps|>
Mix together lemon juice and sugar until smooth.
Ice hot cake.
You may use orange Jello if you wish.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY LUSCIOUS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 packages strawberry gelatin
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1 large package frozen strawberries
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/2 carton dairy sour cream
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Add thawed strawberries with juice, undrained pineapple, and mashed, whipped bananas.
Pour half the mixture into an 8 x 12-inch pan and chill until set.
Spread sour cream over the congealed layer.
Cover with the remaining gelatin mixture and chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ALMOST INSTANT COFFEE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup firmly packed brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter, melted
- 2 (8 oz) packages refrigerated biscuits
<|steps|>
Blend brown sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.
Pour 2 tablespoons melted butter into the bottom of a ring mold, then sprinkle with 4 tablespoons of the sugar-cinnamon mixture.
Dip each biscuit in melted butter, then in the sugar-cinnamon mixture.
Place biscuits from one package in the bottom of the mold, overlapping edges slightly; repeat with the second package for a second layer.
Bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes.
Let stand for about 5 minutes, loosen edges with a spatula, and turn out onto a serving plate.
Serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CUCUMBER PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 gal. cucumbers
- 1 cup. coarse, sack salt
- 1 gal. water
- 1 Tbsp. alum
- Vinegar (enough to cover)
- 5 lbs. cucumbers (weighed after cutting)
- 3 lbs. sugar
- Pickling spices (in 3 small bags)
- 2 Tbsp. Wesson oil
<|steps|>
Soak cucumbers in brine of salt and water for 1 week or longer.
Remove from brine, cut into 1/8 or 1/4 inch round pieces.
Place in alum water (1 Tbsp. alum to 1 gal. water), let stand overnight.
Remove from alum water, cover with vinegar for 24 hours.
Drain vinegar, weigh 5 lbs. cucumbers to 3 lbs. sugar.
Layer cucumbers and sugar in a large jar, placing a bag of pickling spices at the bottom, middle, and top.
When sugar dissolves, add Wesson oil to the top.
Preserve for one year.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ANGEL PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites, beaten stiff
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- ¾ cup graham cracker crumbs
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Whipped cream, for topping
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, baking powder, graham cracker crumbs, pecans, and vanilla; fold into beaten egg whites.
Place mixture in a greased 8-inch pie dish.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
Let cool, then cover with whipped cream and let stand before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PORK CHOP AND POTATO CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 4 medium potatoes, sliced
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Brown chops, place in casserole.
Layer potatoes and onion over chops.
Mix soup, milk, salt, and pepper, pour over.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ARAB SEWALL'S LOBSTER THERMIDOR**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 boiled lobster
- 3 mushrooms, sliced
- 5 tablespoons butter
- Dash of paprika
- 1/8 teaspoon mustard
- 1 tablespoon minced parsley
- 1/2 cup sherry
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 cup cream
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese
<|steps|>
Cut lobster in half, remove meat, and break into small pieces.
Cook mushrooms in 3 tablespoons butter, then add paprika, mustard, parsley, and sherry. Heat to boiling.
Melt remaining butter, blend in flour, add cream, and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
Season with salt, then add the mushroom mixture and lobster meat.
Fill lobster shells with the mixture and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 425°F for 15-20 minutes. Serves 2.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE VALUE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. rice
- 2 cup. cold water
- 1 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Bring rice, water, and salt to a sharp boil.
Turn heat to low, cover, leave for 14 minutes.
Keep lid on to maintain fluffiness, leave small opening to prevent boiling over.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **KENNINGTON'S TEA ROOM SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1 cup. grated American cheese
- 1 small can pimiento, mashed fine
- 1 medium can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 pt. whipped cream
- Maraschino cherry (for topping)
<|steps|>
Prepare Jell-O, beat with rotary or electric mixer when set.
Add cheese, pimiento, and pineapple, mix well.
Fold in whipped cream, mold, top with maraschino cherry.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT MULLED CIDER**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart apple juice or cider
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 cup orange juice
- 2/3 cup lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- Brown sugar, to taste
<|steps|>
Heat apple juice or cider without boiling, and add spices tied in a thin cloth bag.
Remove from heat and let steep until cold.
Remove spices, add orange juice, lemon juice, nutmeg, and brown sugar to taste.
Reheat and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY CHICKEN LAYER**
<|ingredients|>
- **Layer I:**
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 pound can whole cranberry sauce
- 1 (9 oz) can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans or other nuts
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- **Layer II:**
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatin
- 1/4 cup chicken stock
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup chicken stock
- 1/2 cup diced celery
- 2 tablespoons chopped parsley
- Salad greens, mayonnaise, and pecan halves for garnish
<|steps|>
**Layer I:** Soften 1 envelope gelatin in ¼ cup cold water, dissolve over hot water.
Add cranberry sauce, crushed pineapple, chopped pecans, and lemon juice to gelatin.
Pour into a 10 x 16 x 1½-inch baking dish rubbed with salad oil, chill until set.
**Layer II:** Soften 1 envelope gelatin in ¼ cup chicken stock, dissolve over hot water.
Blend mayonnaise, ½ cup chicken stock, diced celery, and chopped parsley with gelatin.
Pour over the set first layer and chill until firm.
Cut into squares, invert onto salad greens, and top with mayonnaise and a pecan half.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SPICED APPLE JUICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart canned apple juice
- 1/2 lemon, sliced thin
- 1 stick cinnamon
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 orange, sliced thin
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- Mint sprig or lemon slice, for garnish
<|steps|>
Combine apple juice, lemon slices, cinnamon, brown sugar, water, orange slices, and nutmeg in a saucepan.
Heat to boiling, then simmer for 10 minutes.
Strain the mixture.
Serve hot or cold, garnished with a mint sprig or lemon slice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT AND SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion, add tomato sauce, salt, and pepper, simmer 15 minutes.
Cook spaghetti, drain.
Mix spaghetti with meat sauce, place in casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BANANA NUT BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. mashed bananas
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream shortening and sugar, add eggs and bananas.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in nuts, pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GLORIOUS GRITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup grits
- 1 roll garlic cheese or American cheese
- 1 stick margarine
- 3 eggs
- Milk (enough to make 1 cup when added to beaten eggs)
- 1/4 pound sharp cheese, grated
<|steps|>
Cook 1 cup grits according to package instructions.
While grits are hot, add garlic or American cheese and margarine, stirring until melted.
Beat 3 eggs with enough milk to make 1 cup, then add to grits mixture.
Place in a 1½-quart casserole dish and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with sharp cheese and return to oven until cheese melts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRACKLIN GOOD CORNBREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cornmeal
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. cracklings
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients, add cracklings.
Combine milk and egg, add to dry ingredients.
Pour into greased baking pan.
Bake at 425°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cooked, mashed carrots
- 1 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix carrots, milk, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes, then 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SKILLET STROGANOFF SANDWICHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons butter or margarine
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 teaspoon finely chopped garlic
- 1 pound (2 cups) ground beef
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 cup chopped cooked mushrooms
- 1 can (No. 1) condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 1 cup sour cream
- 10 sliced sandwich buns
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a skillet, add onion, garlic, and ground beef, and sauté until browned.
Combine flour, salt, paprika, and nutmeg, sprinkle over the meat mixture, and stir until blended.
Add mushrooms and mushroom soup to the meat mixture, then simmer for 10 minutes on low heat.
Pour sour cream over the top, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes longer.
Serve by placing 1/3 cup of the hamburger stroganoff in each bun.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. milk
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 baked pie crust
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix brown sugar, flour, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add butter and vanilla, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope Knox gelatin
- 0.5 cup cold water
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 large can grated pineapple
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 cup Philadelphia cream cheese (8 oz)
- 0.5 lb Velveeta cheese, cut small
<|steps|>
Heat pineapple, sugar, and lemon juice until sugar melts.
Dissolve gelatin in cold water and add to cooled pineapple mixture.
Stir in Velveeta, cream cheese, and pecans.
Pour into molds and chill until set, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREOLE EGG PLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant
- 2 chopped green peppers
- 1 can mushrooms
- 2 eggs
- Dash of nutmeg
- 1/4 pound cheese
- 2 chopped onions
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 can tomato puree
- 1/2 pint thick gravy
- 3 tablespoons frying fat
- 2 cups crumbled toast
<|steps|>
Cut eggplant in half lengthwise, scoop out the center, and boil until tender.
Fry onions and green peppers in frying fat without browning.
Add tomato puree, tomatoes, gravy, mushrooms, eggs, nutmeg, and crumbled toast.
Mix in the boiled eggplant center and season to taste.
Fill eggplant shells with the mixture, top with grated cheese.
Bake until the cheese is golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. WOOTEN'S JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 eggs
- 1 1/2 cups jam
- 1 cup butter
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 cup flour
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup fresh buttermilk
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon allspice
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, then add eggs and beat slowly.
Mix in spices and well-mashed jam.
Sift flour with baking soda and add alternately with buttermilk to the mixture.
Pour into 9-inch cake pans to make 4 layers.
Bake at 350°F for 25-35 minutes.
Spread with caramel icing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SALAD - TOMATO ASPIC RING**
<|ingredients|>
- **Chicken Salad:**
- 2 cups diced, cooked chicken
- 2 cups diced celery
- French dressing
- 2 tablespoons thin slices of pickles or olives
- Mayonnaise dressing
- **Tomato Aspic:**
- 2 teaspoons gelatin
- 2 2/3 cups tomato juice
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Few grains pepper
- Lettuce leaves for serving
<|steps|>
**Chicken Salad:** Mix chicken, celery, and pickles; moisten with French dressing and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
**Tomato Aspic:** Mix 2/3 cup tomato juice with gelatin and let stand for 5 minutes.
Heat remaining tomato juice with salt and pepper for 5 minutes, dissolve gelatin in the hot juice, strain, and cool.
Pour aspic into a large ring mold or 8 cup rings and refrigerate until firm.
Arrange chicken salad in the center of the aspic ring, place on cup-shaped lettuce leaves, and garnish with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. MOSBY'S EGG PLANT SOUFFLÉ**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 medium eggplant
- 2 teaspoons butter
- 2 teaspoons flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup grated cheese
- Broiled bacon, for garnish
- 3/4 cup soft bread crumbs
- 2 teaspoons grated onion
- 1 teaspoon tomato catsup
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Dash of cayenne
- 2 eggs
<|steps|>
Peel eggplant and cook in salted water until tender. Drain and mash thoroughly.
Make a cream sauce with butter, flour, and milk.
When thickened, add mashed eggplant, onion, bread crumbs, catsup, beaten egg yolks, salt, pepper, and cayenne.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into a buttered casserole and bake at 375°F for 45 minutes.
Garnish with broiled bacon before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIENDSHIP CHEESE SANDWICHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound cottage cheese
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cucumber, grated (unpeeled)
- 1 small onion
- 1/2 cup finely minced celery
- 1/2 cup finely minced green peppers
- Salt, to taste
- Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise, to taste
- Tuna spread, for filling
- Stuffed olives or parsley, for garnish
- Chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cream cottage cheese and mayonnaise using an electric mixer.
Add Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise and salt to taste.
Blend in celery, green peppers, drained grated cucumber, and onion.
Cut bread into small rounds.
Spread one round with mayonnaise and tuna spread, then top with another round.
Ice the top and sides with the cheese mixture.
Decorate with stuffed olives, parsley, or chopped nuts.
Refrigerate on a tray until ready to serve. Can be made several hours in advance.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE WHIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup cooked prunes, pitted and mashed
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 2 egg whites
- Whipped cream, for serving
<|steps|>
Mix mashed prunes, sugar, and lemon juice.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into the prune mixture.
Pour into a baking dish and bake at 325°F for 20 minutes.
Serve chilled with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup sweet milk
- 3.5 cups flour
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 6 egg whites
- 2 cups sugar, for filling
- Milk of 1 cocoanut
- 1 tsp cream of tartar
- 3 egg whites, for filling
- Grated meat of 1 cocoanut
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, gradually add flour sifted with baking powder, and sweet milk.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into layer pans and bake in a moderate oven.
For filling, cook sugar and cocoanut milk until it ropes.
Add cream of tartar, pour over stiffly beaten egg whites, and beat.
Add grated cocoanut and ice the cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 cup Wesson oil
- 3 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1/2 cup catsup
- 1 grated onion
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup white vinegar
- Juice of 1 lemon
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT COCKTAIL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 can (No. 2) fruit cocktail
- 1 cup coconut
- 1/2 cup pecans
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1 stick margarine
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup sugar
<|steps|>
Sift flour, 1½ cups sugar, baking soda, and salt together.
Add eggs, vanilla, and fruit cocktail; beat well by hand (do not use a mixer).
Pour into a greased 13 x 9 x 3-inch pan.
Mix ½ cup coconut, pecans, and brown sugar; sprinkle over the batter.
Bake at 325°F for 1 hour; do not remove from pan.
For the frosting, cook margarine, ½ cup milk, and 1 cup sugar for about 1 minute; pour over the hot cake.
Sprinkle remaining ½ cup coconut and ½ cup pecans on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans tuna
- 1/2 cup stuffed olives, chopped
- 2 tablespoons minced onion
- 3 boiled eggs, chopped
- 1 cup diced celery
- 2 envelopes plain gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 2 cups mayonnaise
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in cold water and set over a pan of hot water to melt.
Combine melted gelatin with mayonnaise, tuna, olives, onion, eggs, and celery; mix well.
Pour into a flat pan or dish and chill, preferably overnight.
Cut into squares of desired size for serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP STUFFED EGGPLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 stalk celery, diced
- 1 quart soft bread crumbs
- 1 large eggplant
- 3 tablespoons butter or olive oil
- 11/2 pounds shrimp, fresh or frozen
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1/3 cup water
- ¾ teaspoon oregano
- 1/2 cup fine dried bread crumbs
- 1 tablespoon melted butter
- Parsley, for garnish
<|steps|>
Shell and devein shrimp.
Cut eggplant lengthwise into halves, scrape out pulp leaving ½-inch thick shells, and cook pulp in water just to cover until tender (about 15 minutes); drain well.
Cook shrimp in boiling salted water for 3 minutes, drain, soak in cold water, and dice, reserving a few whole shrimp for garnish.
Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a skillet, add onion and celery, and cook until tender but not browned.
Add soft bread crumbs, water, salt, oregano, cooked eggplant, and diced shrimp to skillet; toss gently until well mixed.
Fill eggplant shells with mixture.
Combine dried bread crumbs with 1 tablespoon melted butter and sprinkle over shrimp mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until crumbs are browned.
Garnish with whole shrimp and parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 2-2.5 lb chicken
- Butter, for greasing
- 1 cup vinegar
- 1 cup water
- 0.33 cup catsup
- 1 lb butter
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Cayenne pepper, optional
<|steps|>
Split chicken down the back and break the breast bone to lie flat.
Grease both sides with butter and warm in an oven or on the stove slowly.
Boil vinegar, water, catsup, butter, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and optional cayenne for 10 minutes.
Pour sauce over browned chicken.
Bake in a 350°F oven for about 1.25 hours, basting and turning frequently until done.
Optionally, cook over charcoal burners for a superior barbecue.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GOOD COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg yolk
- 1 cup. finely chopped pecans
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tbsp. vanilla
- 1 egg white, beaten
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, vanilla.
Add egg yolk, slightly beaten, then add flour.
Spread on cookie sheet real thin.
Spread egg white over dough.
Sprinkle pecans over egg white.
Bake at 375 degrees.
Dough will puff up, then go down when it all goes down cookies are done.
Cut into squares while warm in pan.
Lift out with spatula and let cool.
<|endofrecipe|>
